said he will step down as chief executive officer in favor of Google Inc. co-founder Larry Page and become executive chairman. Eric Schmidt is`` committed to Google Inc. ,'' he said at the Digital-Life-Design conference in Munich on Tuesday. How long are you committed to doing what you're doing? As long as it's exciting, he said in response to a question about his plans. Advertisement Eric Schmidt , 55, may be considering a career as a television host, the New York Post reported. to report earnings, excluding items, of$ 8.06 a share, on$ 6.05 billion in revenue.`` Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year,'' Eric Schmidt said in a statement. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. In after-hours trading, shares of Google rose 2.1 percent to$ 639.68, despite having closed Thursday's regular session down 0.8 percent. he works on`` strategic projects, in particular working on new products''( Eric Schmidt ). So what will Eric Schmidt be doing now that he is no longer CEO? He is Executive Chairman: As Executive Chairman, I will focus wherever I can add the greatest value: externally, on the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach; and internally as an advisor to Larry and Sergey Brin .

of inner peace,'' said Erika, who adopted one of the Michael Vick dogs, Oliver, and didn't want her last name used because she doesn't want herself or Oliver to be targeted for harassment. But I thought, no, no, no, don't get angry. Don't let a person like that ruin you. If I can't control what happens to him, I can control what happens to me and I can channel this anger into a big bunch of love.
